title: Ebola Denial Still A 'Huge Problem,' Despite Few New Cases In Guinea
teaser: The number of new Ebola cases in Guinea is dropping steadily, but there are still places where people are performing unsafe burials.
contentencoded:
The number of new Ebola cases in Guinea is dropping steadily. According to the World Health Organization, there were a total of 20 confirmed cases this week, down from 45 last week, the lowest number since August of last year.

The government is shooting for zero Ebola cases by mid-March, and schools are back in session for the first time since July of last year.

Still, NPR’sÂ Ofeibea Quist-Arcton tells Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson that there are still pockets of resistance and denial in Guinea where people are performing unsafe burials one year into the outbreak.
